Sure, here are three ideas for a layout of the Destination Details page:

1. Scrolling Layout: In this layout, the top of the page could feature a large hero image of the destination, with a brief introduction to the location and its weather patterns. Below the hero image, there could be several sections that users can scroll through, such as the destination's weather details, recommended activities, and popular accommodations. Each section could have a clear title, image, and brief description, along with relevant information such as temperature, humidity, precipitation, and wind speed. The scrolling layout allows for a lot of information to be displayed in a clear and organized way, and it also allows for easy navigation between sections.
2. Tabbed Layout: In this layout, the Destination Details page could be organized into several tabs, each representing a different aspect of the destination. For example, there could be tabs for Weather, Activities, Accommodations, and Reviews. Each tab could have a different color and a clear icon, making it easy for users to understand the content of each tab at a glance. The tabbed layout allows for a lot of information to be organized in a compact and efficient way, and it also allows for users to quickly switch between different aspects of the destination.
3. Side Navigation Layout: In this layout, the left side of the page could feature a vertical navigation menu, with clear icons and labels for each section. The right side of the page could then display the content for each section, such as weather details, recommended activities, popular accommodations, and user reviews. This layout allows for easy navigation between different sections of the Destination Details page, and it also allows for a lot of information to be displayed in a clear and organized way.
